intro: Phelipanche sinaica, commonly known as the Sinai morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has a tuberous root system, which allows it to survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It is often found in rocky soils and is considered a weed in agricultural areas.
